resources.string: Do you really want to quit BitBanana?

string.name: pin_entered_wrong_wait
string.comment: Parameters: %1$s: Number of seconds to wait

resources.string:
Do you really want to close the channel with:

%s

Do you really want to force close the channel with:

%1$s

Your funds will be locked up for %2$s.
How do you want to use BitBanana?
Create a wallet on this phone.
You first have to connect to a node.
You first have to connect to a node, before you can see your node information and your avatar.
To receive Bitcoin over the lightning network, you first have to open channels.

To receive Bitcoin over the lightning network, at least one of your channels needs some balance on your counterpartys side.

To achieve that, you have to spend something on lightning network first.

In the manage channels area you can always see how much you are able to send or receive over the lightning network right now.
All security warnings are enabled again.

If you copy this data to your clipboard, other apps (also malicious ones) are able to access and modify it.

To be sure nothing has changed while pasting, compare the beginning to:

%1$s

If you copy this data to your clipboard, other apps (also malicious ones) are able to access and modify it.

To be sure nothing has changed while pasting, compare the end to:

%1$s
Always double check the last 3 to 5 digits when pasting from clipboard. A malicious App might have changed the address in the background without you noticing it.
If not scrambled it is easy to guess your PIN just by watching your finger movements.

If you allow screen recording, malicious software might be able to record a video or take screenshots while you are using BitBanana. We recommend to deactivate this only while you want to record a video or take a screenshot.

string.name: guardian_highOnChainFee
string.comment: Parameters are: %1$s%%: % of transaction value. E.g: 13.2%

resources.string:
You are about to pay %1$s%% in network fees.

Possible solutions:
- try a lightning payment instead
- select lower fee, wait longer
- try again later
- transact a bigger amount

Do you want to continue anyway?

string.name: guardian_oldExchangeRate
string.comment: Parameters are: %1$s: Number of hours. E.g: 7.5

resources.string:
You requested an amount as fiat value, but your exchange rate data is old (retrieved %1$s hours ago).
Make sure you have an internet connection or consider requesting directly in Bitcoin.

Do you want to continue anyway?

Are you sure you want to connect to 

%1$s

Please check the hostname carefully.

Are you sure you want to connect to 

%1$s

Please check the public key before adding the wallet.

You are about to open a link with sensitive data in your browser. While BitBanana anonymizes all your traffic with the Tor network, your browser does not. If you want to keep this data private use a Tor browser to open the link.
It\'s time for an update!\n\nThe node you\'re connected to is operating on an outdated version of %1$s. Versions preceding %2$s are no longer supported by BitBanana.

This invoice does not specify an amount. Though very unlikely, invoices without a specific amount can be exploited and the recipient will receive less than expected in that case. If possible use an invoice with a specific amount.

If certificate verification is disabled, you are vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle attack. Only do this if you know what you are doing.

It is advised to get the certificate setup correct instead.
This means the certificate from your node has to have the hostname included that you are using in this connection setting. Add the hostname to tlsextradomain in the lnd.conf before recreating the certificate.

Some data already exists!
Restoring a backup will delete all following data before restoring:

- Node Connection Data
- Contacts

Continue?

Invoices lacking a specific amount pose a security risk. Though highly unlikely, intermediaries along the route may exploit such invoices, causing the recipient to receive less than expected without detection. No such risk exists in payments over a direct channel.

This is a LndHub account. Unless you are the host of the LndHub service, this arrangement is custodial. The entity managing the service has control over your money and can view your transaction history. Only deposit what you\'re willing to trust with them.

You are connected to a wallet using the Nostr Wallet Connect protocol. Unless you are the host of the Nostr Wallet Connect service, this arrangement is custodial. The entity managing the service has control over your money and can view your transaction history. Only deposit what you\'re willing to trust with them.

string.name: guardian_low_onchain_fee
string.comment: Parameters are: %1$d: Number of hours. E.g: 7.5

resources.string: The current fee estimation suggests that this transaction with a fee rate of %1$d sat/vB may never be confirmed. Consider increasing the fee to avoid your transaction getting stuck for a long time.\n\nDo you want to proceed anyway?

By removing the watchtower, all current sessions associated with the tower will be terminated. Some sessions are not yet exhausted. Remaining backups will get lost and won\'t be refunded, even if you paid for the service.

You only have access to an account on the LND node. Unless you are the node operator, this arrangement is custodial. The person managing the node has control over your money and can view your transaction history. Only deposit what you\'re willing to trust with that person.
This UTXO was not locked by you using the BitBanana UI and is likely locked for a good reason. Unlock it only if you are sure it\’s necessary.
Please be aware that this copied log can contain sensitive data. Double-check and edit out any confidential information before you share it with anyone.

Anonymize all web traffic using the Tor network. This only affects things like fetching exchange rates or interacting with LNURL services. Whether or not Tor is used to connect to a node can be set for each node individually in its connection settings.
Automatically check clipboard for data BitBanana can handle.
The total balance is hidden now. Tap the BitBanana logo on the home screen to reveal it.
All balances are blurred now, and the total balance is hidden behind the BitBanana logo. Simply tap any blurred field or the BitBanana logo to temporarily reveal your balance.
BitBanana will be restarted to make this change. Do you want to continue?
Personalize the app to your needs by toggling features on or off.
Please provide the host address for your custom explorer. When you host the block explorer yourself, your privacy is fully maintained.
When querying an address in the explorer, the link to be invoked will be as follows:\nHost + Address Suffix + Address.
When querying a transaction in the explorer, the link to be invoked will be as follows:\nHost + Transaction Suffix + TransactionID.
Tor Browser for Android is required.
The handy ? buttons across the app help new users with detailed explanations.
Provides access to all routing events along with a routing summary.
Make sending money a breeze with a neatly organized contact list.
Advanced management of on-chain funds. Provides a list of all UTXOs and allows to optionally select specific UTXOs when sending funds or opening channels.
While peer management is automated, this feature still offers manual control for viewing and managing your connected peers.
If your node remains offline for a longer duration, watchtowers will protect your funds from any fraudulent activity.
Allows to sign and verify messages with your node.
If enabled, BitBanana will record logs that can be viewed in the Log section in the main menu. Enable it only if you\'re troubleshooting an issue and need to inspect the logs.
This requires Tor. Enable it in settings.
Please provide the host address for your exchange rate provider. When you host the exchange rate provider yourself, your privacy is fully maintained.
Please provide the host address for your fee estimation provider. When you host the fee estimation provider yourself, your privacy is fully maintained.
Include route hints for private channels in invoices
Enable stealth mode to protect against physical searches of your device

string.name: error_blockExplorer_message
string.comment: Parameters are: %1$s: Name of selected block explorer, %2$s: 'mainnet' or 'testnet'

resources.string: "Your currently selected block explorer (%1$s) does not support %2$s. \nPlease go to settings and choose another block explorer to continue."
This is a zero amount payment request. BitBanana does not support zero amount payment requests due to security concerns associated with them.
You are connected to TESTNET. Please use TESTNET addresses or payment requests.
You are connected to MAINNET. Please use MAINNET addresses or payment requests.
You are connected to REGTEST network. Please use REGTEST addresses or payment requests.
To scan QR-Codes you have to allow BitBanana to use the camera.
Your clipboard does not contain any payment data.
Your clipboard does not contain any connection data.
Unable to read QR-Code, please try again.

Unsupported connection format.
Please use one of the following formats:

- Lndconnect string (lndconnect://…)
- Core Lightning grpc (cln-grpc://…)
- Nostr Wallet Connect (nostr+walletconnect://…)
- LndHub (lndhub://…)
- BtcPay Server connection (config=…)
- Full content of your BTCPay Server config file
Could not fetch configuration from BTCPay Server.

Invalid lndconnect string.
Please make sure you used the following format:

lndconnect://[ip]:[port]?cert=[…]&macaroon=[…]

Invalid LndHub connection data.
Please make sure you used the following format:

lndhub://[user]:[password]@[host]

Invalid Nostr Wallet Connect data.
Please make sure you used the following format:

nostr+nostr+walletconnect://[PUBKEY]?relay=[RELAY]&secret=[SECRET]
Your connection information does not contain a macaroon. This is mandatory.
The provided host or port is invalid.

Timeout.
The server is not responding.

- Please make sure you have a good internet connection

- Please make sure the server is running and still has the following IP:

%1$s

Hostname verification failed.

The hostname of your connection does not match the hostname provided in the host certificate.

You either have to disable certificate verification in the nodes connection settings or you have to recreate your certificate. Make sure the hostname is added to the lnd.conf as tlsextradomain before recreating it.
Hostname verification failed.\n\nThe hostname of your connection does not match the hostname provided in the host certificate.
Host (%1$s) cannot be resolved. Please update your node connection settings if your node is now reachable under a different address or hostname.

Connection failed. The host can be accessed, but the node service isn\'t responding.\n\nPlease verify that the node is operational, that the port number (%1$s) is correct, and that port forwarding is set up.
Unable to reach the host.\n\nPlease make sure you have internet connection.
Tor connection failed.\nPlease turn on Tor in the nodes connection settings.
Tor was unable to bootstrap.\n\nBitBanana natively supports Tor. If you use Orbot, please remove BitBanana from Orbot\'s Tor activated list or shutdown Orbot completely.
JSON syntax of the BTCPay server configuration is invalid.
The BTCPay server configuration does not contain a BTC GRPC configuration.
The node is reachable but returns an internal error. This error might be caused by using a wrong port.

The node is reachable but returns an internal error. This error might be caused by using a wrong port. As you are trying to connect to a node on clearnet, disabling Tor in the nodes connection settings might solve your problem.
Connecting BitBanana to Core Lightning via C-Lightning-Rest is not supported. Please check if your node shares cln-grpc connection details and use those for connection instead.

Invalid cln-grpc connect string.
Please make sure you used the following format:

cln-grpc://[ip]:[port]?clientKey=[…]&clientCert=[…]&caCert=[…]
A provided certificate or key is invalid.
The mandatory client certificate is missing.
The mandatory client key is missing.
The provided connection string for cln-grpc is invalid as the parameters are not encoded in base64url format.
Failed to authenticate with the Rest API.

Invalid format.
Please use one of the following:
- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port
- LNURL-Channel

Invalid format.
Please use one of the following:
- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port
You first have to connect to a node before opening a channel.
Could not establish connection to peer node.
Connection has been refused by peer.
Cannot connect to node without IP-address or host.
Could not connect to peer within deadline.
Number of pending channels exceed maximum.
Channel could not be opened within deadline.
Could not open channel with connected node: %s
Peers could not be fetched within deadline.
Peer is offline. Only force close allowed.
Channel could not be closed within deadline.
It looks like someone tried to deactivate your PIN. The App will close now.\nYou can reinstall the app and use the recovery process to regain access to your funds.
An empty name is not allowed.
The payment details did not match the details specified by the invoice you are trying to pay.
Timeout. No route could be found.
No route was found that respects your fee limit of %1$.1f%%. Increasing your fee limit in the settings or opening new channels might solve the problem.

No route was found. You are trying to send an amount that is so small, that many channels might not route it. Please check your the routing settings for your own channels and adapt the MinHTLC value if necessary.
The amount to pay is bigger than what you can send over lightning with your current open channels.
Please make sure the recipient has enabled the keysend feature.
Only payment data is allowed here.
Your node is not fully synced yet. Please try again later.
%1$s seems to block request coming from the Tor network. You might try switching Tor off in the settings or contact the service and request them to update their cloudflare rules.
Exchange rate could not be fetched. The service you are using seems to block request coming from the Tor network. Try switching the exchange rate provider in the advanced settings.
The response from %1$s could not be read.
Connection to LND failed, please try again.
The value has to be bigger than 0.
Invalid format for Lightning Address. A Lightning Address looks like an email address.\n\nusername@domain
Routing Policies updated but for %1$d of your channels the new rules could not be applied.
Fee rate to high. A maximum of %1$.2f%% is allowed.
Access Denied: Unable to read the file. We recommend moving it to a different location, such as the \"Downloads\" folder, and accessing it from there.

You have sufficient on-chain funds, but their confirmation is still pending. Please wait for your on-chain funds to confirm. You can track the status of your funds through the UTXO view or transaction history.
Insufficient lightning liquidity for sending. Open additional channels to increase it.\nCurrent maximum:
Maximum Amount: %1$s\n\nInsufficient lightning liquidity. Increase your channel receiving capacity to raise this limit.
Tor could cause this issue. Please try to deactivate tor in the settings.
Failed to initiate Nostr Wallet Connect connection.
The %1$s input field must not be empty.
The %1$s input field contains invalid data.
The macaroon must be provided in hex format.
The Bitcoin network you are connected to is not supported.
While using %1$s, BitBanana does not support the following feature: %2$s
Unable to scan or detect QR code in the image.
Failed to fetch exchange rates. Your chosen provider requires tor.
Failed to fetch fee estimates. Your chosen provider requires tor.
This payment exceeds your available balance.
Please ensure the data is in the following format:\n\n- pubkey@host:port

Please ensure the data is in one of the following formats:

- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port
An identical payment code already exists.

Invalid format.
Please use one of the following:

- Lightning Address
- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port
- Payment Code
You cannot select channels that are still pending.
You cannot select channels that are currently offline.
The selected channel\'s sending capacity is insufficient.
The selected channel\'s receiving capacity is insufficient.
You must define a maximum fee rate.
The backend responded with an \"insufficient funds\" error. Maybe some channel constraints prevent a channel from spending most of its balance.
Fee limit for payments above %1$d sats: %2$s
The fee for this payment (%1$.1f%%) exceeds the limit specified in the settings (%2$.1f%%).\n\nDo you really want to pay this invoice?
The fee for this payment (%1$d sats) will be higher than the payment amount (%2$d sats).\n\nDo you really want to pay this invoice?
In order to use this feature, you have to setup biometric authentication in your Android system settings.
The app has been reset as the last update included some structural changes.\nUnfortunately you will have to go through the setup process again.

QR-Codes containing the following are valid:

- Bitcoin Address
- Bitcoin Payment Request
- Lightning Payment Request

QR-Codes containing the following are valid:

- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port
- LNURL-Channel

QR-Codes containing the following are valid:

- Lightning Address
- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port
- Payment Code

QR-Codes containing the following are valid:

- Lndconnect string (lndconnect://…)
- Core Lightning grpc (cln-grpc://…)
- Nostr Wallet Connect (nostr+walletconnect://…)
- LndHub (lndhub://…)
- BtcPay Server connection (config=…)
- Full content of your BTCPay Server config file

Lightning:

+ instant
+ low fees
- not always possible

Perfect for small transactions.
Use whenever possible.


On-Chain:

+ always possible
- slower
- higher fees

Good for big transactions.
Use this when Lightning is not possible.
Anything is allowed here.\nJust scan a QR-Code and BitBanana will automatically determine which action to take depending on the data.

Private channels are not more secure, they are just not visible to the network.\nOnly use private channels if you open a channel to a node that does not route payments or when you do not route payments yourself.\nTo route payments your node should have a very high uptime. If you run your node on a mobile device or a device that is often offline, you should not route payments and stick to private channels.

This is your node on the lightning network.

When you tap on your avatar image you will reveal a QR-Code.
Others can scan that code and add you to their contacts, open channels with you or send money to you.

This avatar is unique.
It was automatically generated based on your public key and cannot be changed.

This list of UTXOs represents all your On-Chain funds.\nIn similar fashion to coins, unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) can only be spent as a whole. As UTXOs can have any value you will simply receive change in form of another UTXO when sending transactions.

By locking specific UTXOs here, you ensure they won’t be selected for on-chain transactions or channel openings. UTXOs locked with BitBanana will stay locked for 24 hours, but you have the option to unlock them manually whenever required.
By selecting specific UTXOs you can improve your privacy or save fees in some cases.

By signing a message with your node, you can proof that you are the owner of this node. As the signature contains the nodes public key, others can verify such a signed message.\n\nThis feature can be used in different scenarios like proofing identity or for example to login with your node on some services.

This view shows all the payments that you forwarded for other participants of the lightning network. Moreover you can see the funds you earned for providing that service.

In the lightning network channels are used for payments. When two participants want to send funds to each other but they do not have a channel open between them, they will have to find other participants in the network that have.

Example:
Alice wants to send funds to Carol, but does not have a channel with Carol. A direct payment is therefore impossible. But if Alice has a channel to Bob and Bob has a channel to Carol there is a solution. Bob can forward the payment to Carol.

Payments often use multiple forwardings (hops) to finally reach their destination.

The list of lightning channels represents your lightning funds. Lightning channels are necessary to participate in the lightning network that allows instant and cheap bitcoin payments.

To "convert" on-chain funds to lightning funds you have to open a channel. To "convert" lightning funds back to on-chain funds, you have to close an existing channel.
Both operation, opening and closing channels, are achieved by an on-chain transaction that costs fees. Therefore, try to keep channels open for as long as possible!

An easy way to get started with opening channels is to use lightningnetwork.plus.

Unfortunately these QR-Codes are so big that some devices are not able to scan them. If this is the case for you, you will have to fall back to copy/paste.\n\nIf you need further help, please refer to our setup documentation.

Some payees support or even require you to send them additional information about yourself. For convenience, you can set default values here, so you do not have to enter this information every time. This data is only stored locally on the phone.

Please note that even with defaults set you will still be able to modify the data when doing a payment. You will also still be able to choose which data is sent at all.

You are responsible for deciding whether to use real or fake data. As rule of thumb, we advise only sending real data if it is necessary for some reason. (E.g. when you will receive a code by mail, etc.)

This payee supports or even requires you to send him additional information about yourself.

You are responsible for deciding whether to use real or fake data. As rule of thumb, we advise only sending real data if it is necessary for some reason. (E.g. when you will receive a code by mail, etc.)

If a checkmark cannot be unchecked then this data is marked as mandatory by the payee. If you don't want to send that data you'll have to cancel the payment.
Regardless of the transaction\'s value, you\'ll receive a set base fee for every transaction you forward through the channel. Your total received fee is the sum of this base fee and the fee rate.
The fee rate is a fee that scales with the value of the transaction you forward through the channel. Your total received fee is the sum of this fee rate and the base fee.

Forwarding a payment involves two channels: an inbound channel for receiving a specific amount and an outbound channel for sending the same amount to another peer.

Inbound channel fees allow node operators to more efficiently signal where liquidity scarcities occur. By adjusting this value, you can influence the likelihood of a channel being selected as an inbound channel in routing. The specified value represents the fee you will charge or the discount you will offer when the channel is chosen as the inbound channel.

Technically, a fee can only be set for the outbound channel; thus, for a selected channel pair (inbound & outbound) the inbound fee effectively adjusts the outbound fee by a simple addition. Therefore, a negative number results in a discount on outbound fee, while a positive number will increase it. For security, the total routing fee cannot be negative, ensuring that funds are not lost through routing.

Base fee and fee rate work the same way as they do for outbound fees.
The smallest value you are willing to forward on this channel in a single transaction.\n\nKeep this field empty if you don\'t want to change the current set value.
The maximum value you are willing to forward on this channel in a single transaction.\n\nKeep this field empty if you don\'t want to change the current set value.

BitBanana\'s commitment to also serving experts means offering a rich set of features. However, we recognize that not everyone may require all of these functionalities. With our customizable settings, you have the flexibility to hide any features that are not relevant to your needs, ensuring a tailored experience.

Utilize stealth mode to defend your phone against quick physical searches, creating the illusion that BitBanana isn\'t present on your device. This is achieved by replacing your app\'s icon and name and launching a decoy app. However, note that the app\'s icon and name won\'t be changed in the app list in your system settings.\n\nIt is not a perfect solution, but it helps to make the presence of your Bitcoin software less obvious.

This list displays all the peers currently connected to your node. Peers are essentially other nodes operating within the network. They collaborate by exchanging information, ensuring each node has a clear view of the network's status.

As an example, when your node wants to change something, such as updating a channel policy, it notifies all the peers it's connected to. These peers, in turn, relay the information to their own connected peers, creating a ripple effect that ensures the entire network is informed.

Your node establishes connections with peers automatically, typically prioritizing those peers with whom you have active channels. Nevertheless, you maintain the flexibility to manually establish or break connections and access more details about your peers through this interface.

QR-Codes containing the following are valid:

- pubkey
- pubkey@host
- pubkey@host:port

Your node serves as a private authentication method for accessing a service. The procedure is based on message-signing and does not share any information about your node. If your node stops operating, you will lose the ability to log in to the associated account.

This setting makes using a VPN more convenient by automating it. You can still connect using a VPN even if you do not choose anything here, but then you have to start and stop the VPN manually whenever you want to connect.
The name is only used to organize your nodes in BitBanana. It has no other effect.

For a watchtower to function, some data must be exchanged with it. This results in some information being disclosed to the watchtower's maintainer. The following non encrypted data will be disclosed:
- Frequency of channel updates

Channel balances stay confidential unless your partner cheats and the watchtower detects it. In this scenario, you'll reveal the balances to ensure the protection of your funds.

Keep in mind that a watchtower service cannot take your funds. Their only action during a breach is to initiate a punishment transaction, with the funds going directly to you.

This is your watchtower on the lightning network.

When you tap on the avatar image you will reveal a QR-Code.
This code can be scanned by others to add your watchtower to their list, allowing it to oversee their channels. Be careful, this consumes resources, so avoid sharing this connection data publicly on the internet.

This avatar is unique.
It was automatically generated based on your public key and cannot be changed.
QR-Codes containing the following are valid:\n\n- pubkey@host:port
This label is only meant to organize your payment codes and will not be visible to anyone using the payment code.
Anyone using the payment code will see this description.

Payment codes can be used multiple times. Anyone with the code can make a payment to you without requiring your immediate involvement. However, your node must be online for the payment to go through. Additionally, payment codes offer advanced features like recurring payments and enhanced privacy for the receiver.
Tapping any amount field allows you to change between the currencies you\'ve set up here. If you only select Bitcoin units, the app will stop contacting exchange rate providers.
If this box is selected, BitBanana will use all of your on-chain funds.
If this box is selected, BitBanana will spend all the funds from your chosen UTXOs.
However, if you have open channels, a portion of these funds may be held as emergency reserves to ensure stable channel operation. You might also get some of those funds back as change.

Only use this last hop option when you want to rebalance your channels. To do so, you can effectively send funds to yourself. Generate an invoice and pay it with a specific set of own channels, picking one with high outgoing capacity for the first hop and one with high incoming balance for the last hop. This approach incurs fees but achieves channel rebalancing.

Channel rebalancing keeps your payment channels ready for action! If one side runs low, your channel can only send in one direction, and payments may start to fail. Sending funds in a circular route redistributes balances without the need for on-chain transactions. This view lets you perform such a circular payment. For the best results, pick a channel with high sending capacity and pair it with another that has excess receiving capacity.
Do you really want to delete this node connection?
The data does not contain a valid LNURL.
The withdraw amount is bigger than what you can receive over lightning with your current open channels.
The Service you are interacting with provided invalid data.
Do you really want to open a channel with:
The channel is opening. This may take a while.\nYou can check the channels state in your channels overview.
The amount to pay is bigger than what you can send over lightning with your current open channels.
Your payment was successful, but the secret that you received could not be decrypted.
IMPORTANT:\nThe URL has been copied to your clipboard. Please save it if you need it later. This dialog won\'t be shown again.
IMPORTANT:\nThe code has been copied to your clipboard. Please save it if you need it later. This dialog won\'t be shown again.
The Service answered with an invalid response.
A lightning address is like an email address, but for Bitcoin!
This payment requires an authentication type that is not yet supported by BitBanana.
REST is not supported.\n\nDo you want to try connecting via gRPC?
Found a bug? Let us know!
Tap on your avatar to reveal your node information!
As you are connected to a REGTEST network, this will only work if you configure a custom block explorer in the settings.
Clipboard data found, but it is invalid:
Your clipboard contains payment information. Do you want to initiate a payment?
Your clipboard contains LNURL data. Do you want to use it?
Your clipboard contains a node public key. Do you want to open a channel?
Your clipboard contains connection data. Do you want to add a new node?
The total amount of funds held in this channel. Due to some constraints (like commit fee or local channel reserve) not all of the funds are spendable.

The total percentage of sent and received funds divided by the total capacity of the channel. A channel with an activity over 100\% means that more funds traveled through the channel than it can hold. This metric is designed to show how effective a given channel is.
This shows how long this channel already exists.
This shows the duration for which this channel has been active.
A channel can be public or private. Private channels are not more secure, they are just not visible to the network.

Channels can be closed in different ways. The optimal way is a cooperative close. If one party decides to close the channel without the cooperation of the other party, a so called \"force close\" happens. A force close will normally result in higher fees and the close initiator will have to wait quite some time until he can access his funds. If one party attempts to cheat and gets caught, we have a breach close.
The amount to be paid in fees when closing the channel. This can change over time as the fees are subject to the transaction fees of the bitcoin base layer.
In the event of an uncooperative close (force close) of this channel, the time lock is the number of blocks you will have to wait before you can access your funds again.

The fees you will receive when you forward a transaction through this channel. The total fee you will receive is the sum of the base fee and the fee rate.\nThe base fee is what you get for each forwarding, no matter what the amount of the transaction is.\nThe amount received through the fee rate depends on the amount of the transaction.

The fees the other node will receive when it forwards a transaction through this channel. This only applies to forwarding transactions. You will not have to pay anything if you use this channel for your transactions.

Forwarding a payment involves two channels: an inbound channel for receiving a specific amount and an outbound channel for sending the same amount to another peer. This is the fee that will be charged when the channel is selected as inbound channel.

Technically, a fee can only be set for the outbound channel; thus, for a selected channel pair (inbound & outbound) the inbound fee effectively adjusts the outbound fee by a simple addition. Therefore, a negative number results in a discount on outbound fee, while a positive number will increase it. For security, the total routing fee cannot be negative, ensuring that funds are not lost through routing.

Base fee and fee rate work the same way as they do for outbound fees.

The minimum amount this node is required to reserve in this channels balance. You will not be able to spend this amount. This makes sure you will always have something to lose if you try to cheat your channel partner.
The minimum amount the other node is required to reserve in this channels balance. This makes sure the other node will always have something to lose it tries to cheat you.
The smallest value you are willing to forward on this channel in a single transaction.
The maximum value you are willing to forward on this channel in a single transaction.
The smallest value your peer is willing to forward on this channel in a single transaction.
The maximum value your peer is willing to forward on this channel in a single transaction.

The main purpose of this backup is phone migration. It does neither contain the seed to recover your on-chain funds, nor the channel backup to recover your lightning funds. The backups to recover your funds have to be made outside of BitBanana.

This backup only contains the following data:

- Node configs
- Contacts
- App Settings

Attention! If submitted, these settings will be applied to all of your channels!

Each party has a commitment transaction that only they can broadcast to the blockchain to claim their share of bitcoins. Different types of commitment transactions result in channels having different properties.

In a payment route, each intermediate step defines a specific time window (in blocks) within which it must successfully process the transaction. Otherwise, it will be considered failed due to expiration. In case of payment failures or uncooperative behavior, this time window is crucial because it allows participants at that step to take necessary actions, such as cooperatively reversing the transaction (unwinding the HTLC) or uncooperatively settling it on the blockchain.

A higher value in this context enhances the channel's resilience against temporary node failures. However, it could potentially reduce the attractiveness of the channel for routing because, in the worst-case scenario, payments might experience prolonged delays. Additionally, in rare cases of stuck payments, the funds of the channel participants allocated to that forwarding event will be locked up for the duration of this time window.

144 blocks is about one day.
From now on, BitBanana looks like a simple calculator. To access BitBanana, use that calculator and perform a calculation that equals 21.
BitBanana now looks like a calculator!
Perform a calculation that results in 21
The time it takes for the peer to respond.

Total occurrences of this peer going offline or coming online, documented across restarts. The count reduces gradually if the peer has not recently flapped, allowing forgiveness for historically high flap counts.
Elapsed time since the peer\'s most recent offline event.
The count of channels you have open with this peer.
The total count of public channels maintained by this peer.
Total node capacity, derived from the sum of channel capacities.

To use this VPN you first have to install the %1$s app.
To allow for automation of WireGuard you need to open up the WireGuard app, navigate to its settings, and then allow control for external apps.

You have to install the %1$s app to use VPN specified in your connection settings.
You have to grant BitBanana permission to control %1$s.

Ensure that the %1$s app is running in the background. If it does, make sure all android battery optimizations are deactivated for %1$s and then restart the %1$s app. Use the button below to go to the settings.\n\nIf that doesn\'t help either, open the %1$s app and start the VPN manually to resolve the issue.
